carrying.name: (a small loaf of fine, light bread)

equipped.name: (a pair of dark grey wool pants)

mobs.long_desc: A dwarven guard is here.
mobs.desc: This middle-aged dwarf is clearly an experienced warrior, and he stands impassively while on duty. He is stout and short, like most dwarves, and his impressive red beard falls past his armor to his belly.

mobs.long_desc: A dwarven guard is here.
mobs.desc: This middle-aged guard looks like a very capable warrior. He is a stout dwarf, short and sturdy, and his flowing brown beard goes down his chest to his belly. He handles his weapon like a seasoned veteran.

mobs.long_desc: A dwarven mining worker is here.
mobs.desc: This dirty, overworked dwarf is short even for his race, and his beard is wispy and shot with grey. He shambles along with a slightly harried expression on his features.

mobs.long_desc: A dwarven mercenary lounges around here.
mobs.desc: This hardened battledwarf has a very mean expression on his face most of the time. He stands around with an imperious expression. His black beard goes down to his waist.

mobs.long_desc: A dwarf drinks his life away here.
mobs.desc: There's no telling how old this fellow is. He's short for a dwarf, with a dirty beard. He speaks in slurred tones, but very earnest slurred tones. He weaves around when he walks, which isn't often.

mobs.long_desc: An Anduin gateguard stands at attention.
mobs.desc: Clearly a veteran of many years, this middle-aged dwarf stands at rigid attention while on duty. He has a well-tended, busy beard, and generally a placid, almost serene expression.

mobs.long_desc: The dwarven barkeeper, Shawn, sits here spinning yarns and serving drinks.
mobs.desc: He's a lean, rangy dwarf, muscular and slightly taller than average, with bright brown eyes that twinkle above his large nose and soft, waist-length beard. His favorite form of entertainment is obviously sitting and telling stories, since that is what he does every chance he gets.

mobs.long_desc: A huge, muscular dwarf rests here.
mobs.desc: He's huge, for a dwarf, and scarred all over. He has a raucous voice, coarse and crude, and the rest of him isn't much better. He has one eye missing, and though he is bald, his beard is amazingly luxurious.

mobs.long_desc: A dwarven guard makes sure people don't go where they shouldn't.
mobs.desc: He's an extremely capable warrior, clearly a member of the Haven from his armor. He handles his weapons like a seasoned fighter, standing near the west exit to make sure non-members don't get past.

mobs.long_desc: A dwarf sweeps up here.
mobs.desc: He's very old and hunched over, and his beard is in bad condition -- in need of serious combing! He doesn't pay much attention to things going on around him.

mobs.long_desc: A stray dog wanders past here.
mobs.desc: He's a hound-dog, with a melancholy expression and an unkempt coat of coarse fur. He pads along looking for food most of the time.

mobs.long_desc: A peasant begs for coins here.
mobs.desc: He is old, with a wispy beard and wispy hair, though his eyebrows are still very bushy. Clad in filthy rags, he hobbles when he has to walk, and prefers to stand still and beg for money.

mobs.long_desc: A bespectacled grocer tidies up his shelves.
mobs.desc: He's rather short and very old, with a bald head and wispy white hair running around his head at about ear level. He has a very red nose, and his cheeks are ruddy. He has a friendly demeanor, but talks too quickly.

mobs.long_desc: An gnarled old dwarf tends bar.
mobs.desc: He's old, with a thick grey beard, and looks decidedly cranky. His rough voice constantly hurls abuse at deadbeats, and he doesn't hesitate to throw someone out if he thinks it necessary.

mobs.keywords: jarad grindstone baker dwarf dwarven shopkeeper
mobs.long_desc: A dwarven baker merrily restocks shelves.
mobs.desc: He's a jolly little fellow, with a goodly paunch and a quick smile. His dark brown beard flows down to his belly, and it, like the rest of him, is liberally dusted with flour.

mobs.long_desc: A muscular dwarf tends the forge.
mobs.desc: He is stout and extremely muscular, with reddened skin and a truly luxurious beard. He is also quite bald. The blacksmith is generally covered in a liberal coating of soot from the forge.

mobs.keywords: jasper ironfeld weaponsmith anduin shopkeeper jolly dwarf
mobs.long_desc: A pleased-looking, jolly dwarf extolls the virtues of his wares here.
mobs.desc: He is a little rotund, but his love for weapons is obvious from just talking to him for a moment -- he smiles broadly as he shows off this or that example of his craft, and his measured voice is extremely knowledgable. His white beard is lovingly tended.

mobs.long_desc: A grim-looking dwarven guard stands near the door.
mobs.desc: He's fairly young, and stout, with well-developed muscles. Short and stout, like most dwarves, he has a well-trimmed beard and moustache and a grim, passive expression.

mobs.long_desc: A white-bearded dwarf hands out letters here.
mobs.desc: He looks fairly old, with a long white beard and wispy white hair under his cap. Short and stout, like most dwarves, he has a slightly superior air as he hands out letters and packages.

mobs.long_desc: A young druidic guard stands here, watching over his surroundings.
mobs.desc: The tired look on this man's face suggests that he has fought and killed many a foe.  He is equipped with a deadly longsword, and appears ready to strike at any time.

mobs.long_desc: The Warrior Coach, your guildmaster, is standing here.
mobs.desc: With scars all over his face and arms, this man has obviosly done his share of fighting.  He stands here waiting to assist you in any way possible .

extras.text: These boots are made of boiled leather with a linen lining, and all along their surface are riveted many bands of bronze for strength and protection.  The toes are also bronze-capped.  They buckle along the side.

objects.ground: A dwarven steel breastplate lies here.

extras.text: This breastplate straps to the chest, with straps provided for sleeves, a belt, and leggings to attach.  It is clearly of dwarven manufacture, with tooling and all sorts of fancy, yet infinitely useful, embellishments.  It is made from the finest quality steel.

objects.ground: Some steel sleeves lie here in tubes.

extras.text: These fine, shiny sleeves are obviously of dwarven make.  Finely articulated, with copped elbows and oiled hinges, they are easy to wear and strong enough to turn most injuries.  They have straps at the top to attach to a breastplate or vest, and other buckles close them under the arm, where the seam is.

These shiny steel leggings are in the shape of two tubes, each one buckling at three points and again at the top, to fasten to a vest or belt.  They are obviously dwarf-made, being embossed and beautifully made.

objects.ground: Some fine steel gauntlets lie here.

extras.text: Finely articulated, these gauntlets cover the forearm to the back of the hand. Each joint is beautifully crafted, each one three parts. They are obviously dwarven-made, being embossed and shiny.

objects.ground: A finely made half-helm rests here.

extras.text: It's a half-helm of excellent craftsmanship, made from light but strong steel. It covers most of the head, with a nosepiece to protect the nose and cheek guards.

objects.ground: A small pale pastry lies here.

extras.text: It is a small roll that smells of lemon -- finely baked, and light as thistledown.

objects.short: a small loaf of fine, light bread
objects.ground: A loaf of bread lies here.

extras.text: It is a loaf of bread -- not very large, intended to be eaten by one person for one meal. The bread is light and smells delicious, with a crunchy outer crust.

objects.ground: A handful of travel biscuits lie here.

extras.text: These small, hard biscuits are pale and smell of wheat flour.
It has a fairly short, sturdy wooden handle, and a good sturdy axehead on its end.  It's well-made, and though intended for wood, would double as a good weapon.

objects.ground: A fountain carved out of rock stands in the middle of the plaza.

extras.text: This fountain appears to be a solid part of the ground, and is smoothly carved upward into a round, shallow fountain. The water inside the fountain looks quite safe.

objects.ground: A bowl of potato and turnip stew lies here.

extras.text: This plain wooden bowl holds a generous serving of stew. Diced potatoes and turnips are liberally laced with spices and then cooked in a milk based broth.

objects.ground: A broom lies flat on the ground here.

extras.text: It's a plain-looking broom with broomstraw bound to its lower tip by withes.

objects.ground: A large sealed jug sits here collecting dust.

extras.text: The jug is cheaply made from clay, but looks watertight.

objects.ground: Some waybread has been put here.

extras.text: The waybread is the traditional feed of elves when travelling.  They call it lembas.  It is said to refresh the weary traveler greatly.

objects.ground: A tall glass is sitting here, half full...or half empty.

extras.text: The glass is slightly cloudy.  Its tall form could easily hold more than enough alcohol to make one drunk...

shops.no_such_item1: %s Sorry, I don't stock that item.
shops.no_such_item2: %s You don't seem to have that.
shops.do_not_buy: %s I don't trade in such items.

shops.no_such_item1: %s Sorry, I don't stock that item.
shops.no_such_item2: %s You don't seem to have that.
shops.do_not_buy: %s I don't trade in such items.

shops.no_such_item1: %s Sorry, I don't stock that item.
shops.no_such_item2: %s You don't seem to have that.
shops.do_not_buy: %s I don't trade in such items.

shops.no_such_item1: %s Sorry, I don't stock that item.
shops.no_such_item2: %s You don't seem to have that.
shops.do_not_buy: %s I don't trade in such items.

shops.no_such_item1: %s Sorry, I don't stock that item.
shops.no_such_item2: %s You don't seem to have that.
shops.do_not_buy: %s I don't trade in such items.

shops.no_such_item1: %s Sorry, I don't stock that item.
shops.no_such_item2: %s You don't seem to have that.

triggers.name: dwarf_laborer_rand1
triggers.commands: say Ah, almost time to get back. say I still haven't found anyone decent... emote looks concerned. comfort worker

triggers.name: dwarf_laborer_rand2
triggers.commands: emote glances at you for a second. chuckle say Nope, not strong enough for the mines, need dwarven miners.

triggers.name: dwarf_laborer_rand3
triggers.commands: emote mutters to himself and looks at his watch. sigh say So little time, and so much to do.

triggers.name: dwarven_merc_rand1
triggers.commands: emote mutters to himself. say That stupid Ruborg, saying I wasn't even in the wars. say If I see him... grin say Well, he won't like it.

triggers.name: dwarven_merc_rand2
triggers.commands: emote expounds loudly on the virtues of the battleaxe over the sword.

triggers.name: dwarven_merc_greet1
triggers.commands: if %actor.name% == -1 nudge %actor.name% say Hey %actor.name%, did I tell you about the part I played in the Great Duergar Wars? strut say I captured three duergar captains single-handedly. endif

triggers.name: drunk_dwarf_rand1
triggers.commands: set antic %random.3% switch %antic% case 1 emote whistles tunelessly to himself. say Another day of drinking for me please. hiccup hiccup break case 2 glare say What are you looking at? emote puts up his fists. say Do you want some?  Do ya? fart break default drink drunkdrink burp emote wipes his mouth. say Aaaahhhh thas the good stuff... done

triggers.name: drunk_dwarf_rand2
triggers.commands: glare say What are you looking at? emote puts up his fists. say Do you want some?  Do ya? fart

triggers.name: dwarven_janitor_entry1
triggers.commands: sigh say So much litter, this job is unending. grumble

triggers.name: dwarven_janitor_rand1
triggers.commands: emote mutters about pay and conditions these days.

triggers.name: dwarven_janitor_rand2
triggers.commands: emote sweeps around your feet without even noticing you.

triggers.name: dog_greet1
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 emote stops scratching itself and looks up at %actor.name% if %actor.align% > 349 lick %actor.name% else growl %actor.name% bark bite %actor.name% endif endif

triggers.name: dog_greet2
triggers.commands: msend %actor% %self.name% wanders up to you and sniffs your leg. msend %actor% %self.name% whimpers and moves away from you with its tail between its legs.

triggers.name: lame_beggar_rand1
triggers.commands: emote mutters to himself. say Being a beggar just isn't such a good calling these days. emote scratches at a sore.

triggers.name: lame_beggar_rand2
triggers.commands: emote holds his sore ridden hands out to you. say Please spare some money, my children are starving.

triggers.name: lame_beggar_bribe
triggers.commands: wait 1 mecho %self.name%'s eyes light up. if %actor.sex% == Female say Thank you so much, madam! else say Thank you so much, sir! endif

triggers.name: new trigger
triggers.commands: say My trigger commandlist is not complete!

rooms.name: The Dwarven Sector Entrance
rooms.description: This large plaza is the entrance to the Dwarven Sector. Large buildings, almost majestic in their grandeur, stand close together near the plaza's edges, and streets lead off to the north and south. It is not a rich area of town, though it is tidy, for the most part. The mountain is, of course, quite visible as it rises upward beyond here, and the rest of the city can be seen there. The Mercenary Haven stands to the west, and Circle Street leads off to the north and south.

North.description: The path leads off in this direction.

East.description: This way leads out of the dwarven sector.

South.description: The path leads off in this direction.

West.description: This door leads into the famous Boulderdash Head Quarters.

rooms.name: A Bend in Circle Street
rooms.description: This narrow little street is thick with traffic, and is clearly not adequate for the bustle it endures. Buildings stand all along the street, preventing it from being widened. The ground appears to be hewn right from the living rock of the mountain, for it bears no flagstones. It's also dirty. The street twists to the west and south. The entrance to the Dwarven Sector lies to the south.

South.description: This way leads to the Dwarven sector entrance.

West.description: The path continues this way.

rooms.name: A Bend in Circle Street
rooms.description: This well-paved road runs from north to west in a smooth curve of tightly-fitting flagstones. The people here look fairly well clothed, and guards are much in evidence. The buildings here are all made of smoothly hewn stone that looks like it was made from the mountain itself.

North.description: This way leads to the Dwarven sector entrance.

West.description: The path continues on this way.

rooms.name: A Dwarven House
rooms.description: This small house is tidy, with a thin carpet on the rock floor and a few little tapestries on the stone walls. A pair of lanterns lights the place fairly well. But other than a few furnishings, there is little of interest here.

West.description: A door leads outside.

rooms.name: Circle Street
rooms.description: This narrow street runs from east and west. The paving isn't as tidy as one might wish, and the traffic is far too thick for the road, with guards' presence not as strong. The houses lining the street are small and hunched close together.

East.description: The path continues on in this direction.

West.description: The path continues on in this direction.

rooms.name: Entrance to the Mercenary's Guild
rooms.description: The headquarters of the famous Anduin Mercenary Haven, this large entry hall is adorned with weapons and armor from many lands, all of the quite old and well-used.  The room smells of sweat and pheromones, for some reason.  Despite the odd smell, it is a tidy area, with duty rosters and training schedules hanging from the wall.  The Inner Sanctum is up a flight of stairs, and the entrance to the Dwarven Sector lies to the east.

East.description: The door leads out onto the circle path.

extras.text: Under the rosters and duty assignments you see a wanted poster that reads: *************************************************************************** WANTED DEAD or ALIVE (preferably DEAD) L O G A N 1,000,000,000 coins

rooms.name: Circle Street
rooms.description: This wide street runs from east to west through a pleasant area of the Dwarven Sector. Buildings stand close together here, right up at the edge of the street, and traffic is moderate to light most days. The presence of guards is much in evidence.

East.description: The path continues on in this direction.

West.description: The path continues on in this direction.

rooms.name: A Small, Ramshackle House
rooms.description: This small house is quite ramshackle, with old reeds on the floor and beaten up wooden furniture. The stone walls are dank, uncovered by any tapestries. The only door lies to the west.

West.description: A door leads outside.

rooms.name: A Dwarven House
rooms.description: This little house is tidy and clean, with a carpet on the floor and a pair of lanterns in sconces on the east and west walls. There's little furniture and little of interest here. The only door is set in the south wall.

South.description: The door is here.

rooms.name: North Street
rooms.description: This is the eastern end of North Street. The street is wide, to accommodate the heavy traffic, and tidy, paved with flagstones that fit together neatly. Various houses stand to the north and east, with a far less reputable-looking street leading off to the south. North Street continues on to the west.

North.description: A door leads into the house.

East.description: A door leads into the house.

South.description: You see Circle Path.

West.description: North street continues this way.

rooms.name: Circle Plaza
rooms.description: The circular path comes to a head here, at a grandly paved circular plaza. The street is nowhere near as neat as it is to the north, on North Street, and the traffic is heavy, as is the noise and commotion. North Street leads off to the north.

North.description: This way leads to North street.

East.description: The path continues on this way.

West.description: This way leads to a bend in the path.

rooms.name: Shawn's Tavern
rooms.description: This large tavern reeks of the unlikely combination of scents of smoke, ale, and fried potatoes. The noise is quite loud at all hours of the day or night, and the patrons are almost all raucous and quite tipsy. The bar is long and low to accommodate the dwarves who mostly patronize this establishment, and the walls are covered in war trophies like shields and swords, all obviously well-used. Kegs of ale line the back wall, waiting to be used, and a general air of merry mayhem seems to permeate the whole chamber. A staircase leads upstairs to private rooms.

West.description: The door leads to the fountain square.

Up.description: These stairs lead up into the Penthouse.

Down.description: A trapdoor is hidden in the floor.

extras.text: This is the most ugly behemoth head you have ever seen! (If you have ever seen any.) Underneath the head is a small brass plaque.
Defeated by Megadeath - Date Unknown.

The sign reads: Instructions provided by Shawn (Who else would.) BUY  - Buy a drink from Shawn (That's me) LIST - Shawn will show you a list of the local specialties with prices. Don't ask to run a tab!!!!!! No credit here!

rooms.name: Circle Plaza
rooms.description: This is one of the many squares and plazas in the Dwarven Sector, recognizable by the ubiquitous reddish-brownish-orange rock of the paved street and of the many crowded houses along here. Three streets converge here, with Circle Street running east-west and South Street taking up to the south.

East.description: The path continues on in this direction.

South.description: This way leads to South Street.

West.description: This way leads to a bend in the path.

rooms.name: South Street
rooms.description: This is the eastern end of South Street. Neatly paved, it bears moderate traffic from people on foot. Houses crowd close together here, some of them with upper stories that overhang the street. A plaza stands to the north.

North.description: You see Circle path.

East.description: A door leads up into the house.

South.description: A door leads into the house.

West.description: South street continues this way.

rooms.name: A Tidy Home
rooms.description: This little home is very tidy, with a thick carpet on the floor and tapestries on the walls. But there is little here of interest, only some wooden furniture and a lantern.

North.description: A door leads outside.

rooms.name: A Small House
rooms.description: This little one-room building is carved from the rock of the mountain, with a thatched roof and rush-strewn floor. There is little here in the way of furniture, and only a small lantern dangling from the ceiling for light.

South.description: The door is here.

rooms.name: North Street
rooms.description: North Street runs from east to west through a tidy part of the Dwarven Sector. Sturdy houses and shops line the street, each one built close to its neighbors. Traffic through here is fairly heavy, consisting almost entirely of foot traffic.

North.description: You see a dwarven house.

East.description: You see North street.

West.description: You see a bend in North street.

rooms.name: A Bend in Circle Street
rooms.description: Circle Street twists here to avoid running into some rather large stone buildings that look like masonry offices. The road here is hacked right out of the living rock of the mountain, and it is neither smooth nor clean. The traffic is quite strong, with people on foot surging along the road to the east and south, toward a square.

East.description: This way goes on to the t-cross.

South.description: You see the fountain square.

rooms.name: Fountain Square
rooms.description: Circle Street empties into this square before continuing on its way north and south. Though it is not very clean here, the widened square is far more able to handle the busy flow of traffic. This is obviously a major shopping district, with a tavern to the east and a grocer to the west.

North.description: You see a bend in the path.

East.description: This door leads into the famous Shawn's Tavern.

South.description: You see a bend in the path.

West.description: The grocer is this way.

extras.text: The fountain is huge. It is made of black marble and looks like it took many men many months to make. There is some writing carved onto it. It has a strange aura around it.
To all those of MEGADEATH gone from us and those still alive: You will not be forgotten. "The Few, The Proud, The Well Armed"

rooms.name: A Bend in Circle Street
rooms.description: This narrow street bends here, curving from east to north.  It is full of people and clearly inadequate for the amount of traffic it has to hold.  The noise is quite intense, as well.  Buildings are cramped all along the street, their second floors overhanging the street.

North.description: You see the fountain square.

East.description: This way goes on to the t-cross.

rooms.name: South Street
rooms.description: This tidy, wide street is lightly travelled by people on foot, with guards looking on serenely to make sure things are quiet. Houses stand all along the street, close together, some of them with overhanging second floors.  The street is paved very neatly with flagstones that fit together tightly.

East.description: You see a bend in North street.

South.description: A door leads into the house to the south.

West.description: You see a bend in South street.

rooms.name: A Small Home
rooms.description: This small one-room home looks for all the world like it has been carved out of the rock of the mountain that forms Anduin's backbone. The floor is rough, but covered with reeds, and tapestries cover the walls and make the room seem less dank. There's little of interest here, and very few pieces of primitive furniture. The only exit is the door to the north.

North.description: You see North street.

rooms.name: A Bend in North Street
rooms.description: North Street bends here, heading east and south. It is neatly paved with tightly-fitting flagstones, and is fairly clean for an often- travelled street. The traffic is fairly heavy through here, consisting of a broad cross-section of society, all watched over by guards.

East.description: You see North street.

South.description: You see another bend in North street.

rooms.name: A Bend in North Street
rooms.description: North Street bends here, twisting around various sturdily made buildings, mostly private homes. The road is fairly neat, and paved with flagstones fit tightly together. The traffic is all on foot, and the dwarves visible look fairly well dressed. Guards posted here and there ensure that nothing too untoward can happen.

North.description: You see another bend in North street.

West.description: You see another bend in North street.

rooms.name: The Filled Pantry
rooms.description: This tidy little shop has a clean wooden floor overlaying the rock, and whitewashed walls. The traffic through here is bustling, with people constantly coming in and perusing the shelves of goods.

East.description: This way leads to the fountain square.

extras.text: The sign reads. BUY   -  Buy something on the list LIST  -  List goods for sale with prices VALUE -  The Grocer will tell you how much he will pay you for an item. SELL  -  To sell an item to the Grocer. (Assuming he wants to buy it)

rooms.name: A Bend in South Street
rooms.description: South Street twists here, heading from south to west. The street is tidily paved, and it is fairly quiet here, with mostly houses visible along the street. Traffic is fairly light.

South.description: You see another bend in south street.

West.description: You see another bend in south street.

rooms.name: A Bend in South Street
rooms.description: South Street bends here, running from north to east.  The street is tidy, paved with stone tiles that interlock perfectly.  The traffic through here is not heavy, being mostly shoppers and citizens heading to and from their homes. Guards ensure that things are quiet.  A post office nestles against the city wall to the south.

North.description: You see another bend in South street.

East.description: You see South street.

rooms.name: Wall Path
rooms.description: A roughly hewn path runs along the outside of a curving wall surrounding the city of Anduin. The view here is magnificent, spanning the rest of the mountain, and the verdant countryside below. The mountain range nearby is mist-shrouded and mysterious, with the occasional road passing through them. The city is visible behind the wall.

West.description: You see the wall path.

rooms.name: The Drunken Ogre Inn
rooms.description: This rough bar is ramshackle and poorly lit. Benches and tables, all scarred and beaten-up, stand around the central room, and their occupants look uniformly like the roughest people imaginable. The place reeks with the smells of unwashed bodies and bad food and worse drink. The only visible exit lies to the west.

West.description: The door leads out to the Drunken path.

Down.description: Looking down you see a covered hatch. You weren't meant to see this.

rooms.name: A Bend in North Street
rooms.description: North Street bends here, running to the east and south. Numerous buildings crowd around the edges of the well-paved street, and traffic through here is fairly heavy. Guards look over the crowd frequently. To the south, a large plaza is visible.

East.description: You see another bend in North street.

South.description: You see a t-cross.

rooms.name: Heredjor Plaza
rooms.description: This large plaza sees a lot of traffic, since it's where North and South Streets converge. The main crossroads of the Dwarven Sector lie to the west. Many citizens and shoppers go about their business, ignoring the many guards on sentry duty. The crossroads is paved neatly in flagstones that are tightly fitted together.

North.description: You see a bend in North street.

South.description: You see a bend in South street.

West.description: You see the crossroads.

rooms.name: A Bend in South Street
rooms.description: This is the beginning of South Street. It is tidily paved and fairly clean, with light traffic consisting mostly of homeowners and citizens. The presence of guards more or less ensures that it'll stay quiet along its twisting length. A T-cross is visible to the north.

North.description: You see a t-cross.

East.description: You see another bend in South street.

rooms.name: The Breadbasket
rooms.description: This tidy, well-tended shop is clean, but still has a light dusting of flour everywhere -- on the tiled floor, on the whitewashed walls, and on the shelves full of goods. Windows carved into the living-rock walls let in light, but there are also lanterns hanging from the ceiling. A sign stands on the counter, near the back of the shop. The only door leads out to the west.

West.description: You see Bakers road.

extras.text: The sign reads as follows: WELCOME to Jarad Grindstone's Dwarven Bakery! The Finest Bread goods this side of Anduin List - Jarad will give you a list of breads available for sale with the price. Buy  - Buy one of Jarad's fine breads or pastries All service with a smile!   8-)

rooms.name: Wall Path
rooms.description: This path runs along the outside of the city's wall, and it is hewn right out of living rock. From here, the view of the surrounding lands is magnificent, with forests predominating and other mountains rising into the mists all around. The city of Anduin rises up above the wall, with stone buildings predominating.

West.description: You see the wall path.

rooms.name: Wall Path
rooms.description: This path runs along the outside of the Anduin city wall, and is hewn right from the rock. The city is visible over the wall, but the view on the other side is much better -- vast mountains and forests.

East.description: You see the wall path.

West.description: You see the wall path.

rooms.name: The End of the Dark Alley
rooms.description: The dark alley ends here, turning toward the entrance of a thoroughly disreputable-looking bar, the Drunken Ogre. The buildings that make up the alley's walls look equally disreputable, with boarded up windows and peeling paint. The ground is littered with refuse, most of which is thankfully unrecognizable.

East.description: You see a door leading into The Drunken Ogre Inn.

South.description: You see the Drunken path.

rooms.name: A Dark Alley
rooms.description: This dark alley runs from north to south. The buildings on either side of it are quite disreputable, with boarded up windows and peeling paint, and the amount of litter and grunge in the alley is prodigious. There are not many travelers here, but then, there wouldn't be room for many. The alley ends to the south, at a crossroads.

North.description: a bend in Drunken path.

South.description: You see the crossroads.

rooms.name: The Crossroads
rooms.description: This bustling crossroads sees much activity, with mostly dwarves heading in all directions.  Most of the people look respectably middle class, but there are a few very rich looking people, and some beggars. A dark alley leads off northward.  Ironworkers Way lies to the west, and Bakers Road to the south.

North.description: Drunken path goes off in this direction.

East.description: You see a t-crossing in this direction.

South.description: Bakers road goes off in this direction.

West.description: You see Ironworkers way.

rooms.name: Bakers Road
rooms.description: This tidy little road is clean, with small stone buildings and shops standing to the east and west. The traffic through here is moderate, mostly middle-to-upper class dwarves, and the presence of guards ensures that nothing untoward is expected to happen. A crossroads lies to the north.

North.description: You see the crossroads.

South.description: You see a bend in Bakers road.

rooms.name: Bakers Road
rooms.description: This tidy, narrow street has a rock floor, probably carved right out of the mountain itself, and a well-tended look. The moderate traffic through here seems directed toward the baker's shop to the east, but homeowners, children, and other sorts routinely go through here.

North.description: You see Bakers road.

East.description: You see the local dwarven baker.

rooms.name: Wall Path
rooms.description: This path runs along the outside of the city wall, and is hewn right from the living rock of the mountain that houses Anduin. The view from here is extremely good, with forests and other mountains dominating the landscape.

East.description: You see the wall path.

West.description: You see the wall path.

rooms.name: Wall Path
rooms.description: This rocky path runs along the outside of the sturdy city wall. It, like the wall, is hewn right from the living mountain, and girdles it. The view here is stunning, revealing mountains and forests as far as the eye can see. The path bends to the west.

East.description: You see the wall path.

West.description: You see a bend in the wall path.

rooms.name: The Blacksmith
rooms.description: This smithy is, like all smithies, extremely hot from the cherry-red forge visible off near one wall, and, like all smithies, very loud from the constant ringing of hammers. Despite how unpleasant it is, there is a steady stream of visitors coming and going, browsing, or exchanging words with the gruff workers here.

South.description: the door leads out to Ironworkers way.

rooms.name: Ironworkers Way End
rooms.description: This is the northern end of Ironworkers way. To the north is the Blacksmiths and to the west it the Weapon smithy.

North.description: You see an entrance to the Blacksmiths.

South.description: You see Ironworkers way.

West.description: This way leads to the Weapon smith.

rooms.name: Ironworkers Way
rooms.description: The smell of iron and forges is quite strong here, and the noise of hammering and voices is very evident. This vibrant intersection leads north toward various metalsmith shops, and south to a stable -- the scent, again, is very indicative. The crossroads lies to the east, and a gatehouse to the west.

North.description: You see northern Ironworkers way.

East.description: You see the crossroads in this direction.

South.description: You see southern Ironworkers way.

West.description: You see the western gate house.

rooms.name: Entrance to the Warrior's Guild
rooms.description: This remarkably clean room leads into the inner chamber of the warrior guild.  There is a large table in the center, and a small fireplace located in the western side of the room.  A large black rug provides a comfortable cushion for your legs, while the large weapon racks make you wonder what kind of inside.  Training takes place to the south.  There are four large guards blocking the path inside.

North.description: Ironworkers way leads off this way.

South.description: You see (and smell) the stables.

rooms.name: The Warrior's Inner Sanctum
rooms.description: The ceiling rises higher and higher as you enter this large arena.  Old helmets and broken weapons clutter the ground, left behind by past pupils. Large candles all around the room ensure a safe training session, and the large fighting area provides plenty of room to master your skills.  Your guildmaster stands in the center of the room awaiting your arrival.  He stands tall with a large smile on his face, acknowledging that you have arrived.

North.description: You see Ironworkers way.

rooms.name: Wall Path
rooms.description: This path runs along the outside of the city wall, and is hewn right from the living rock of the mountain that houses Anduin. The view from here is extremely good, with forests and other mountains dominating the landscape.

East.description: You see the wall path.

West.description: You see a bend in the wall path.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Wall Path
rooms.description: This rough path runs along the outside of the Anduin city walls. It encircles the mountain, giving a superb view of the surrounding countryside. There is little traffic along here, of course, but aside from the view, there is little here to investigate, anyway.

East.description: You see the wall path.

South.description: You see a bend in the wall path.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Wall Path
rooms.description: This rocky path runs along the outside of the Anduin city walls. The buildings of the city rise behind the wall, but cannot be reached from here. The view from here is magnificent, showing the nearby mountains and forests, and the roads running between them. The wind up here is strong but livable. The path bends here, running from north to west.

North.description: You see a bend in the wall path.

West.description: You see a bend in the wall path.

rooms.name: The Weaponsmith
rooms.description: This large shop looks prosperous and tidy, with the forge obviously located elsewhere. Shelves and display racks show off a number of finely made weapons, most of them expensive. Especially fine examples of his work are mounted on the walls. The one door stands to the east.

East.description: You see Ironworkers way.

rooms.name: Western Gate House
rooms.description: This formal-looking gatehouse is made of stone carefully mortared into a thick wall. It is set into the wall itself, which runs all around the mountain city. The crossroads leading to the various shopping districts lies to the east.

East.description: You see Ironworkers way.

West.description: You see a gate leading to the Western Watch tower this way.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Wall Path
rooms.description: This path, hewn from the living rock, runs along the outside of the tall wall surrounding the city of Anduin, carved into the mountain here. The view is magnificent, covering the mountain range, the forests, and various paths leading to strange buildings far, far away.

South.description: You see a bend in the wall path.

West.description: You see a bend in the wall path.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Wall Path
rooms.description: This path follows the outside of the city wall. Hewn from the living rock, it isn't clear who uses this path, since there's absolutely nothing here except the path and the wall. The view, however, is magnificent, showing the nearby countryside -- mountains, forests, and mists. The wall is rather tall, but the city of Anduin rises behind it.

North.description: You see a bend in the wall path.

East.description: You see the wall path.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Wall Path
rooms.description: This little path runs along the outside of the Anduin city walls, and is hewn right from the living mountain. The view here is magnificent, with many mountains and forests visible. Anduin's many buildings rise up behind the wall. The path curves here.

East.description: You see a bend in the wall path.

South.description: You see the wall path.

rooms.name: Wall Path
rooms.description: This path runs along the outside of the city wall. It is hewn right from the mountain, and encircles it, giving a beautiful view of the lands below and around here. A path leaving the city is visible to the southwest, and the city itself rises behind the sturdy wall. The western watchtower stands to the south.

North.description: You see the wall path.

South.description: You see the Western Watch Tower.

rooms.name: Western Watch Tower
rooms.description: This tall tower is made of stone, mortared into a tall watchtower that overlooks the countryside around the Anduin city's mountain. The tower smells dank, with moisture seeping out onto the stones, but the mortar is in excellent condition. The watchtower entrance lies to the east, with a path running along the outside of the walls to the north and south. A path leads outside of the city, to the west, heading into the mountain range.

North.description: You see the wall path.

East.description: You see a gate leading to the watch tower gate house.

South.description: You see the wall path.

rooms.name: Wall Path
rooms.description: This roughly hewn path is carved right out of the rock of the mountain it circles. It runs along the outside of a tall wall that surrounds Anduin, the dwarven city. The view here is stunning, showing the path leading down into the mountain range, and beyond it, into strange lands. Behind the wall, the city is visible, and a squat watchtower to the north.

North.description: You see the watch tower.

South.description: You see a bend in the wall path.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Wall Path
rooms.description: This path runs along the outside of the great wall that surrounds the outer surface of Anduin. Carved from the living rock, the path is about halfway up the mountain. The scenery around here is quite stunning, showing the mountain range nearby, and forests abounding below. Behind the wall, the city of Anduin is visible.

North.description: You see the wall path.

East.description: You see a bend in the wall path.

rooms.name: Shawn's Basement
rooms.description: Creaky stairs lead downward into a dark, forbidding cellar. There are boxes and kegs everywhere, and in the dim lighting, it is impossible to see what they hold. Stuffed animal heads adorn the walls and lie in half-opened boxes, and the ever-present noise of footsteps upstairs, give the room a slightly eerie feeling to most people.

Up.description: The trapdoor leads back up to Shawn's

extras.text: This crate is filled with weapons and armours that look like they've seen many a battle.

rooms.name: Penthouse Hallway
rooms.description: You have entered the penthouse hallway. There are doors leading off in all directions. All the doors have brass plaques with names on them. Shawn doesn't usually allow his customers up here. So don't let him catch you.

North.description: You see a door here, the sign reads "Poe".

East.description: You see a door here, the sign reads "Hanover".

South.description: You see a door here, the sign reads "Kriel".

West.description: You see a door here, the sign reads "Lucky".

Down.description: The stairs lead down to the tavern.

rooms.name: Poe's Room
rooms.description: This is Poe of Megadeath's room. It is sparsely decorated in elven design. there are a few chairs and a bed. On a dresser you see a few of his personal belongings.

South.description: This door leads back out into the hallway.

extras.text: On the dresser you see a few items such as lockets and jewelry.

rooms.name: Lucky's Room
rooms.description: This room belongs to Lucky, also known as Milo Swift. There are a few chairs and a bed. In the corner is a card table with a deck of playing cards (obviously marked) and a pair of six sided dice (obviously loaded). In the other corner you see a spear leaning against the wall.

East.description: The door leads out into the hallway.

extras.text: This is the fabled silver spear known as Firnmir - the Giant Slayer.

rooms.name: Hanover's Room
rooms.description: This large chamber belongs to a warrior of some reknown. It is filled with weapons, furs, trophies, and the various accoutrements warriors always seem to have around. The bed is short but wide, with slightly dirty sheets. The room smells strongly of beer. The one door stands to the west.

West.description: The door leads out into the hallway.

rooms.name: Kriel's Room
rooms.description: Incense wafts through the air, and paper lanterns dangling from the ceiling by brass chains illuminate this tidy, luxurious bedroom. A large circular bed draped in red silk stands against one wall, and an equally large circular window is set into another wall, showing the square outside. There is little to indicate the owner's personality, other than a small collection of glass figurines and incense burners set on the bureau. The one door stands to the north.

North.description: The door leads out into the hallway.

rooms.name: Outlaws Hideout
rooms.description: This small, nearly empty room is carved out of the rock of the mountain. There are some boxes that seem to double as chairs, and some empty kegs that serve as tables.  The dust is quite thick, and there are no lanterns, making the room difficult to navigate.

Up.description: Looking up you can barely make out the outline of a trapdoor.

rooms.name: The Inner Sanctum of the Mercenary's Guild
rooms.description: This sparring pit is wide and spacious, and surrounded by various practice weapons in racks.  It is bare of decoration, though the wood of the walls is quite attractively moulded.  The bare floor looks like it was hewn from solid oak.  The only exit is down some stairs.

rooms.name: A Post Office
rooms.description: This tidy little room has a wooden floor and stone walls.  It is more or less undecorated -- almost spartan in feel.  A desk stands near the western wall, with lots of cubbyholes behind it for storing messages.  Only exit lies to the north.

rooms.name: The Pawnbroker's Back Room
rooms.description: This is where the pawnroker conducts his shady transactions.  How does he get here?  For that matter, how did YOU get here??
